quest.name: The End of a World
journal: Alisaie is steeling herself for the task ahead.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch holds the Exarch captive somewhere within that vast city... Yet even if we must search every alleyway, we will find them!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It's big, I'll grant you. But cluttered city streets are far more conducive to infiltration than wide-open spaces. This will work to our advantage. Trust me.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: You'd think all those tall, dark buildings would be frightening, but for some reason they just make me feel sad...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: One cannot blame the Ondo for fleeing the spectacle of these brooding edifices. We, however, have not the luxury of fear...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We have found our destination, but how to descend into the city itself...?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's intimidating, yes, but we have to start somewhere...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Why don't we have a closer look at that tower to the southeast? We might be able to reach it from the edge of the trench.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Look at the size of those doors... Now I know how pixies must feel.

dialogue.name: ELEVATOR03652
dialogue.text:
(-Echoing Voice-)Forename Surname recognized...
Welcome to the city of Amaurot.

dialogue.name: ELEVATOR03652
dialogue.text: (-Echoing Voice-)Will you be riding the lift?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Wh─!? Did the building just welcome you?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mayhap it is not so passing strange... Did Emet-Selch not invite Forename to visit his abode?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain thy coming was expected.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And where will this lift be taking us?

dialogue.name: ELEVATOR03652
dialogue.text: (-Echoing Voice-)The lift services every level of Achora Heights, but is presently configured to convey passengers directly to the ground floor.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well, there you have it. In the absence of some few hundred yalms of rope, we have little choice but to accept the offer.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: With emphasis on the we. I'm not about to let you walk into that place alone.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I wish to ride the lift.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Ground floor. Now.

dialogue.name: ELEVATOR03652
dialogue.text:
(-Echoing Voice-)As you wish.
The lift will arrive shortly.

dialogue.name: ELEVATOR03652
dialogue.text:
(-Echoing Voice-)Next stop: Ground Floor.
Facilities include the Bureau of the Administrator, the Bureau of the Architect, and the Capitol...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Each of these towers seems a veritable city in itself... Even a gigas would feel inadequate in such surroundings.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Seems peaceful enough─he said, tempting fate.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I just can't believe how tall everything is!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If mine eyes do not deceive, we stand in some manner of communal square...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Just a moment. I thought I saw something.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Descend to the ground floor of Achora Heights?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's only at this distance that you start to realize just how big the buildings truly are... What did that voice call the city? “Amaurot”?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Look! Over there!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Is that...a person? Ah, no, my mistake. That's a giant.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It doesn't seem to have noticed us yet...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Giant or no, a resident of this place may have much and more to tell us. I say we make the first move.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud, you can't just─ Ugh!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Pray excuse my boldness, but might I ask you a few questions...?

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: Oh, what adorable costumes. Are you children on an excursion? This district has much to teach you.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: How odd... That sounded like no language I've ever heard, and yet I understood every word...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Just as he understood us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ahem. And which district is this, exactly?

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: You must be lost, poor things.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: You stand in the Polyleritae District, wherein lie the institutions most vital to the management of our star.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you ask?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Can you tell us where to find Emet-Selch?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Can you tell us who rules this city?

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: Ah, I see. You've come to marvel at the workings of the Convocation of Fourteen.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: Who rules...? What a curious question. Mayhap you refer to our supervising body, the Convocation of Fourteen?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So Emet-Selch isn't the leader here...

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch is a member of the Convocation. Were you hoping to witness its deeds firsthand?

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: Hm hm hm... Hardly surprising, I suppose. The whole world holds its breath as the Final Days draw near, and our brightest minds race to implement their plans.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: ...Thus you must understand that gaining an audience at this time will be next to impossible.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: You should hurry home now, before your families begin to worry. Do you need me to walk you back?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: N-No thank you. We will be fine.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENT03652
dialogue.text: Very well. Take care, little ones...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What was that all about...?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: To my eyes, these people appear as arcane entities. I suspect Emet-Selch wove them from aether, much as he reconstructed the rest of the city...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The Final Days...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Such words well befit the oblivion described to us by our Ascian foe.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: A catastrophe of unprecedented scale, which did set in motion the summoning of Zodiark...and thence Hydaelyn Herself.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But...that happened centuries and centuries ago, didn't it?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: That man spoke as if they were rushing to avert a disaster here and now.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Unless... For these people, the distant past is the here and now!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I believe thou hast the right of it, Master Alphinaud. This aetherial Amaurot and its residents appear to be phantoms of a different age.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch hath resurrected a memory─a moment in time from before the star was sundered.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: So, we find ourselves in a long-destroyed city inhabited by the long-departed. An unusual situation, to be sure─but at least we're able to parley with these ancients.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...In fact, they seem downright eager to chat. I say we use this to our advantage─split up, strike up some conversations, and see if we can't learn the location of our quarry.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And while we're at it, it wouldn't hurt to wheedle out a few more details regarding this Convocation of Fourteen and their impending disaster.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: To mingling, then. Let's meet back here when our jaws start aching.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTA03652
dialogue.text: Hm? 'Twould seem the Hall is host to a most precocious visitor this day. And what, pray tell, shall be the subject of our discussion, young one?

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTA03652
dialogue.text: Ah...the Convocation and their handling of the coming peril. 'Tis only natural that you should have questions.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTA03652
dialogue.text: Shall we begin with the members themselves? As all know, the Fourteen are the wisest and most puissant among us. They are the stewards of order, responsible for decisions which keep this star turning season after season.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTA03652
dialogue.text: Be it the speaker, Lahabrea, or the emissary, Elidibus, each seat is occupied by an elected sage of surpassing intellect.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTA03652
dialogue.text: Loghrif, Mitron, Emet-Selch... Their individual titles have, as a gesture of respect and a matter of tradition, become synonymous with their incumbents.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTA03652
dialogue.text: Thus it is with great incredulity that I greet this recent rumor that a seat in the Convocation is soon to be left vacant.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTA03652
dialogue.text: If proven true, 'twould be an unprecedented development─and testament to the immense pressure under which our saviors are toiling... In any event, I for one am confident they shall deliver our star unto salvation.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTB03652
dialogue.text: Good gracious, child, where is your family? You should not be alone at a time like this. Run along home. Quickly now!

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTB03652
dialogue.text: Have you not heard? Though yet confined to the lands across the sea, a terrible phenomenon afflicts our star. They are calling it the “Final Days.”

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTB03652
dialogue.text: 'Tis said it starts suddenly, a cacophonous keening from beneath the earth. The sound distorts all living things within earshot, and wrests from us control of our creation magicks.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTB03652
dialogue.text: Once that happens, all is lost. Fear, pain, despair...every dread impulse is siphoned from our minds and given substance: an eternal fall of fiery rain; an incessant spawning of nightmarish beasts...

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTB03652
dialogue.text: None can point to the source of the phenomenon. 'Tis as if the star itself has fallen ill─as if a force inimical to life now festers and spreads.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTB03652
dialogue.text: 'Tis only a matter of time until Amaurot, too, resounds to that discordant squall. You should stay with your loved ones, child... Stay with them...

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTC03652
dialogue.text: An audience with Emet-Selch? I am afraid you have the wrong office, little one. And besides, he will be far too busy to field the questions of curious children.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTC03652
dialogue.text: Surely you have been told of the looming catastrophe? Every resource available to the Convocation must be spent upon ensuring our world survives.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTC03652
dialogue.text: They have yet to make an official announcement, but it is said the Fourteen are moving forward with a plan of scarce credible proportions─one which promises to grant will to the very star itself!

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTC03652
dialogue.text: They will invoke our mightiest spells of creation to birth an entity of all-encompassing magnificence...and then they will rewrite the laws of existence.

dialogue.name: AMAUROTRESIDENTC03652
dialogue.text: 'Tis a huge undertaking, and it must be completed ere the corruption spreads this far. Thus I say to you again: do not hold out hope for an audience...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, that was an experience. I was never very fond of being treated like a child, but it did make asking questions less suspicious.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename. If I was not certain before, then I am now─the people of this city believe they face the end of the world.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I cannot imagine what purpose compelled Emet-Selch to recreate this ancient “Amaurot.”

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And yet...I fancy I hear his words to us echoing throughout this ocean trench. He would have his story known.
